title: Two killed in underground explosion at Endeavor Mine near Cobar, NSW | ABC NEWS
description: Two people have been killed in an explosion at an underground mine in western NSW. A man in his 60s died underground, while a woman in her 20s died after she was brought to the surface with critical injuries. Operations at the Endeavor Mine near Cobar have been suspended while the community deals with the tragic incident. title: At least eight Qld schools teach wrong topic for Year 12 exam | ABC NEWS
description: In a serious curriculum blunder, at least eight Queensland state high schools have taught Year 12 students the wrong topic for their Ancient History exam. Students studied Augustus, an exam topic in previous years, instead of Julius Caesar. title: Australia's biggest electricity user could close due to power prices | ABC NEWS
description: Australia's largest aluminium smelter has begun a consultation process with employees about the future of its operations.   Tomago Aluminium says, despite extensive engagement, it has not identified a pathway that supports commercially sustainable operations beyond 2028. title: Trump heaps praise on new Japanese PM, Albanese talks with south-east Asian leaders | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 US President Donald Trump has heaped praise on Japan's new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi in Tokyo, as the pair discussed military spending and signed a deal on critical minerals.  00:39 Defence partnerships were also front of mind as Anthony Albanese held talks with south-east Asian leaders in Malaysia, where trade, security and climate change have been high on the agenda. Political reporter Stephanie Borys is travelling with the Prime Minister. title: Calls for Royal Commission into the childcare industry | ABC NEWS
description: Early childhood advocates are calling for the creation of a new national oversight body and strengthening of quality standards, with for-profit centres overrepresented in statistics of child abuse. The calls come after an explosive Four Corners investigation exposed the number of paedophiles who have infiltrated the childcare sector. title: NSW govt rejects medicinal cannabis defence for drivers, drug advice for music festivals | ABC NEWS
description: Several key recommendations from the NSW government's 2024 Drug Summit have been rejected. A decision to allow medicinal cannabis users a legal defence during roadside drug tests has been deferred. Also, a proposal to scrap sniffer dogs and strip searches at music festivals was knocked back. title: Aboriginal people hold a story about a 37,000 year old volcanic eruption | Deep Time | ABC NEWS
description: In south-west Victoria, Gunditjmara people have a story about Budj Bim erupting, which they say was a creator being revealing himself in the landscape. The lava flow formed volcanic rock which was used to build the Budj Bim eel traps and stone huts thousands of years later. title: Week-long defamation trial of Senator Price wraps up in the Federal Court in Darwin | ABC NEWS
description: A seven-day defamation trial against senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price in the Federal Court has wrapped in Darwin.   The senator is being sued by Central Land Council CEO, Lesley Turner, over a media release distributed by her office in 2024.   The release called for a change in council leadership, and repeated claims made by former chairman Matt Palmer, alleging the CEO had faced a no-confidence motion.  On the final day, the senator was accused of failing to check the truth of her claims about the CLC boss. Court reporter Olivana Lathouris has this piece for ABC News Northern Territory. title: BoM reacts to new website backlash | ABC NEWS
description: The Bureau of Meteorology launched a new website design on October 22 and received a flood of complaints about the refreshened look.  Senior meteorologist Jonathan How tells News Breakfast that the BoM 'acknowledges' that the changes take some time to 'get used to'. title: US and Japan sign critical minerals and rare earths deal  | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Continuing the second leg of his trip to Asia, US President Donald Trump has met with Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi to sign a deal securing the supply of critical minerals and rare earths through mining and processing. Stephen Nagy, a professor of politics and international studies at the International Christian University, tells The World this partnership between the two countries will help them invest more in the technologies needed for the process to work smoothly. title: Lithuania temporarily shuts its border crossings with Belarus | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Lithuania has announced a temporary closure of its border crossings with Belarus, after balloons frequently crossed over into Lithuanian airspace, leading to the shutting down of a major airport. Linas Kojala from the Geopolitics and Security Studies Center in Lithuania told The World these latest incidents are part of a wider strategy of aggression from Belarus. title: Australia moves to protect art from AI training | ABC NEWS
description: The government has definitively ruled out introducing a copyright exemption for artificial intelligence (AI) companies training their models on Australian creative works.  A copyright exemption for AI companies was floated by the government's Productivity Commission in August, sparking alarm throughout the creative sector, which warned it would give a free pass to tech giants to continue using work without permission.
